tasks.description: Design shared memory protocol - Define SharedArrayBuffer layout with header (indices, flags) and message slots, specify atomic operation sequences for lock-free send/receive, document memory ordering requirements, create protocol specification.

Implement SharedMemoryChannel - Create bi-directional lock-free channel using SharedArrayBuffer, implement send() non-blocking with Atomics, receive() non-blocking, receiveBlocking() with Atomics.wait(), handle message serialization to slots.

Create structured clone optimization - Detect transferable objects automatically, optimize ArrayBuffer/TypedArray transfers, implement zero-copy path for supported types, fallback to JSON for complex objects.

Implement message batching - Batch multiple small messages into single transfer, implement flush timer and size threshold triggers, optimize for latency vs throughput tradeoff, add batching configuration options.

Add Transferable detection/optimization - Implement isTransferable() type guard, auto-detect ArrayBuffer, MessagePort, ImageBitmap, etc., create transfer list automatically, warn on accidental non-transfer of large buffers.

Implement result streaming - Support streaming large results back via SharedArrayBuffer, implement chunked transfer for results exceeding slot size, add progress events for large transfers, handle backpressure.

Fallback to IPC when SAB unavailable - Implement feature detection for SharedArrayBuffer (requires COOP/COEP headers in browser), create transparent fallback to postMessage/IPC, maintain API compatibility, log degraded mode warning.

Sprint 6 integration tests - Benchmark shared memory vs IPC transfer speeds, test large message handling (1MB+), verify atomic operations under contention, test fallback behavior, cross-browser compatibility testing.
